titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tony Geiss Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday May 2, 2019 at 03:04

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings, notebooks, scripts, files, awards, audiovisual material, stuffed animals, printed material, and other papers relating to Tony Geiss and his work on Sesame Street and other television and film projects.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tony Geiss Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Tony Geiss
bioghist.p: Tony Geiss (1924-2011) was an American screenwriter, songwriter, and television producer best known for his longtime work on Sesame Street. He also co-wrote feature films including An American Tail and The Land Before Time.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tony Geiss Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Boxes 54-61 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 62-65 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notebooks, legal pads, typescripts, and other manuscript material, including some corresondence. Consists primarily of working notes for scripts and songs, talks and recollections, as well as to do lists and schedules.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragmentary manuscript notes, typescripts, annotated photocopy schedules, and memos to Sesame Street writers, song lyrics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, typescripts, working drafts, shooting scripts, memos, and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes, typescripts, working drafts, shooting scripts, memos, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Sesame Street scripts, seasons 28-30; Elmo's World scripts, seasons 31-32
Season 33 scripts for Sesame Street and Elmo's World
Season 34 scripts for of Sesame Street and Elmo's World
Scripts for Seasons 37 and 38 of Sesame Street and Elmo's World
Scripts for Seasons 37 and 39 of Sesame Street and Elmo's World

Sesame St: A Night at the Metropolitan; Follow That Bird; Don't Eat the Pictures; Encyclopedia; Big Bird in Japan; Sing!; OTC Notes; The Tokyo String Quartet; The Alpha Thieves; Policy Song for Sony Theatres; The Best of Kermit on Sesame Street; CinderElmo.
Lloyd Morrisset Retrospective; The Furry Arms; The Best of Me / The Best of Grover; Bernice / The Great Pigeon Chase; Daisy; Mrs. Sparklenose's Flying Fairy School; Between the Lions; Theo & Cleo
Unproduced special Sesame Street Discovers America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Development materials for Abby Cadabby, various other projects.

did.unittitle: Children's Television Workshop reference and research materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Muppet character descriptions, Joan Ganz Cooney material, curriculum materials, internal memos, resource guides, set guides, promotional photos, workshop predictions, and research materials.

did.unittitle: Scripts, correspondence, manuscript lyrics and manuscript music, notes, lead sheets, recording session logs, storyboards and copyright material
Scripts, correspondence, manuscript lyrics and manuscript music, notes, lead sheets, recording session logs, storyboards and copyright material
An American Tail, The Land Before Time Began, The Tale of Peter Rabbit
The David Frost Show; The Robert Klein Show; The Dick Cavett Show; Not the Network News; The David Letterman Show
Cos, Ivan the Terrible, Robert Klein special, Tap Happening, 13 Stars for 13, When Things Were Rotten
Ball Four; Navy Brat / Operation Amanda; Oh Kay!; Wall Street By Night; After Rehearsal; Language Review; One Reel; Woof!
Working Draft material, various projects, The Velveteen Rabbit
Notes, drafts, and final versions of identifiable independent projects and collaborations
Notes, drafts, and final versions of independent projects and collaborations, largely unidentifiable

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scripts include The Web, The Bones of Danny Winston and Rib Ann McGee, Character, and Cocoon: The Musical.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, legal documents, film promotional material, and other papers by, to, or relating to Tony Geiss's mother Marjorie Geiss.

did.unittitle: Corresondence, appointment book, personal and finacial papers, film still, undeveloped disposable camera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous printed material and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Awards and related documentation, including Emmys, the Prix Jeunesse International, and others.

did.unittitle: Children's Television Workshop, Dance Along, dup 2/90
Children's Television Workshop, Selected International Segments for Henson Special, approximately 35:00, dup 10/10/88

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included with the tape is a list of programs dated September 1988.

list.head: Selected Segments for Henson Special
list.item: 1. PLAZA SESAMO III, Mexico - Opening - Montoya (Bird) in park with kids. :35

2. PLAZA SESAMO, Mexico - Studio - Montoya (Bird) and cast member walk into a surprise birthday party to join the entire cast, including Bodoque (Grouch) and kids. Montoya is trying to knock down pinata. 2:45
3. CANADIAN SESAME STREET, Canada - Candian Muppet insert - Dodie (Bush Pilot) and Basil (Bear) fly over Toronto and join a parade. :58
4. SESAME, Philippines - Urban Opening with kids, Pong (turtle) and Kiko (Monkey-like grouch). 1:35
5. SESAME, Philippines - Studio - Pong (turtle) and kids line up in size order and pretend to be a train while woman cast member looks on. 1:18
6. SESAME, Philippines - Rural Opening with kids and Pong (turtle). 1:35
7. RECHOV SUMSUM, Israel - Opening with kids and Kippy Ben Kipod (Porcupine). 1:00
8. RECHOV SUMSUM, Israel - Studio - Family Album - Moishe Oofnik (grouch) shows his family album to Kippy (Porcupine). Moishe Oofnik is embarrassed to show Kippy his baby picture. 2:44
9. PLAZA SESAMO III, Mexico - Opening with kids running. :40
10. RECHOV SUMSUM, Israel - Muppet - "Rubber Duckie" - Ernie is playing in his bathtub with his rubber duckie -- singing him a song. 2:22
11. SHALOM SESAME - Hebrew/English - Muppet - "Cookies In Bed" - Ernie is enjoying eating cookies in bed while Bert is telling him not to because he might get crumbs in his pajamas. 1:30
12. IYSS, Kuwait - Season I - Studio - Kids singing with puppets. 3:45
13. CANADIAN SESAME STREET, Canada - Calgary stampede. Dodie takes up to a local festival in Canada. 1:23
14. CANADIAN SESAME STREET, Canada - Maple leaf. Basil talks about maple leaves. 1:21
15. SESAME, Philippines - Studio segment with cast and kids. 2:33
16. SESAME, Philippines - Clip of pony (turtle) and Kiko (monkey). After Philippines. :41
17. PLAZA SESAMO III - Kids Faces Open. :37
18. PLAZA SESAMO III - Counting Song with cast, kids. Montoya (parrot) Bodoque (brown, furry). 2:07
NOTE: "Rubber Duckie" segment is available in: French, Hebrew, Spanish and Arabic (on 16 mag)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The audiocassette includes a list of contents from a variety of selections. Selections 1-6 from "Pinocchio" (Music: Mary Rodgers, Lyrics: Sheldon Harnick). Margie is Pinocchio. Selection 7 from "Alice in Wonderland" (Music: Joe Raposo, Lyrics: Sheldon Harnick). Margie is the dormouse in "Unbirthday Song". Selections 8 + 9: "Good at Making Friends" and "An Unkind Word" from "Heidi's Song" (Music: Burton Lane, Lyrics: Sammy Cahn). Margie is Heidi.
